speaker: MORRIS
line: Once upon a time, there was a guy with the improbable name of Fox Mulder. He started out life happily enough, as these things go. He had parents who loved him, a cute kid sister. He had a roof over his head, got all his flu shots, had all his fingers and toes and aside from being stuck with the name "Fox" which probably taught him how to fight-- or not-- he pretty much led a normal life. But the worst thing by far-- the biggest kick in the slacks this kid Fox ever got-- was what happened to his sister. One day, she just disappeared.

speaker: MORRIS
line: Now, Fox buckled down and worked his butt off. Graduated top of his class at Oxford then top of his class at the FBI academy. None of that hard work made up for his sister, though. It was just a way of putting her out of his mind. Finally, the way I figure it, he went out of his mind and he's been that way ever since. Fox Mulder pissed away a brilliant career, lost the respect of supervisors and friends and now lives his life shaking his fist at the sky and muttering about conspiracies to anyone who will listen. If you ask me, he's one step away from pushing a baby carriage filled with tin cans down the street. But now, all that's going to change.

speaker: MULDER AS MORRIS
line: Tell them the truth, you lying son of a bitch! He's not me, Scully! Scully! Scully, he's not me!

speaker: MORRIS AS MULDER
line: You hate me now, right? Dana, I'm sorry I naked on you to Kersh, but I...I was scared you were going to lose your job.

speaker: SCULLY
line: You did the right thing, Mulder.

speaker: MORRIS AS MULDER
line: I did?

speaker: SCULLY
line: I've been telling you for years you should play more by the book, haven't I?

speaker: MORRIS AS MULDER
line: Hey, it's the new me.

speaker: MULDER AS MORRIS
line: Hey... Hey, fellas, take... What about these? Come on, fellas.

speaker: LANA CHEE/PILOT
line: You ain't going nowhere, mibby. You and me have had our asses officially disappeared. Looks like we're up fudge creek.

speaker: MULDER AS MORRIS
line: Who are you?

speaker: LANA CHEE/PILOT
line: Call sign's Maverick. Not like I'm going to be hot- sticking it anytime soon

speaker: MULDER AS MORRIS
line: Are you all right, Ma'am?

speaker: LANA CHEE/PILOT
line: "Ma'am?" Kiss my ass, you desk monkey.

speaker: MORRIS AS MULDER
line: No, no, no. Up, up... Whew. I am Tiger Woods.

speaker: MORRIS AS MULDER
line: So, what did Kersh say?

speaker: SCULLY
line: He said that I was willful, insubordinate and not a team player and the FBI didn't need agents that weren't team players.

speaker: MORRIS AS MULDER
line: What a jerk. Then what?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Two-week suspension without pay.

speaker: MORRIS AS MULDER
line: You're not serious. Who does he think he is?

speaker: SCULLY
line: See you in two weeks.

speaker: MORRIS AS MULDER
line: Dana? You suppose a home-cooked meal might ease the pain

speaker: MORRIS AS MULDER
line: Think she likes me, Tiger.

speaker: LANA CHEE/PILOT
line: So there I am with this wet-behind-the-ears Rio flying back seat and I'm thinking, hell, man I'm going to give this cherry the ride of his life." So I'm putting the spurs to her, you know? And I'm doing a little hassling with my wingman, Buzzsaw. Now, Buzzsaw...

speaker: MULDER AS MORRIS
line: Hey, Maverick would you mind?

speaker: LANA CHEE/PILOT
line: Hold up. Buzzsaw gets on my zero. He's right on my zero. And when Buzzsaw gets on your zero...

speaker: MULDER AS MORRIS
line: Maverick...?

speaker: LANA CHEE/PILOT
line: ...he's like a damn dog tick.

speaker: MULDER AS MORRIS
line: Maverick?

speaker: LANA CHEE/PILOT
line: You ain't shaking that son of a gun.

speaker: MULDER AS MORRIS
line: Hey, Grandma Top Gun, will you shut the hell up?!

speaker: LANA CHEE/PILOT
line: You're my bitch now pencil-neck.

speaker: GUARD
line: General Wegman wants to see you.

speaker: GENERAL WEGMAN
line: Son... You got a set on you. I'll say that much.

speaker: JEFF
line: You had us fooled. Why didn't you tell us what you were doing from the start?

speaker: MULDER AS MORRIS
line: Meaning?

speaker: GENERAL WEGMAN
line: It's the wrong one. You replaced the flight data recorder. This one's from...

speaker: HOWARD
line: A scrapped F-111, sir. It's junk. You gave the FBI the wrong flight data recorder. Why?

speaker: JEFF
line: Morry, if you were running a scam on the FBI why didn't you let us in on it?

speaker: MULDER AS MORRIS
line: I didn't know if I could trust you. We have a security leak, gentlemen and for all I knew it was one of you. That's why I decided I should approach Agent Scully alone to find out who her contact is. Unfortunately, her partner Agent Mulder screwed everything up.

speaker: HOWARD
line: So why didn't you tell us all this afterward?

speaker: MULDER AS MORRIS
line: I knew that you wouldn't believe it until you figured it out for yourself.

speaker: HOWARD
line: So the real flight data recorder is safe?

speaker: MULDER AS MORRIS
line: Oh, yeah. Absolutely.

speaker: HOWARD
line: And you will bring it back?

speaker: MULDER AS MORRIS
line: Of course.

speaker: GENERAL WEGMAN
line: By God, you do got a set on you. I wish I could say the same about some of your colleagues. About those who proffer rumor and innuendo those who make dangerous accusations.

speaker: HOWARD
line: Sir, Morris's behavior seemed to....

speaker: GENERAL WEGMAN
line: You can explain yourself to the review panel in Washington. I've already wired them recommending censure for your actions. You're lucky I didn't throw you in the stockade.

speaker: MORRIS AS MULDER
line: Uh-huh.

speaker: MORRIS AS MULDER
line: A little mood lighting for the bedroom. No bedroom.

speaker: MORRIS AS MULDER
line: This guy hasn't been laid in ten years.

speaker: MULDER AS MORRIS
line: Hey, Chris. Hey, I like the, uh... The, uh... The nose...

speaker: CHRIS
line: Ouch! As if.

speaker: MULDER AS MORRIS
line: Terry. Buddy. Hey, Terence. Sorry. How's it going?

speaker: TERRY
line: Mom says she's taking out a restraining order on you.

speaker: JOANNE MORRIS
line: What are you doing back?

speaker: MULDER AS MORRIS
line: Joanne...

speaker: JOANNE MORRIS
line: Your stuff is all outside. Take it and get out.

speaker: MULDER AS MORRIS
line: Joanne, listen to me. There's something I got to tell you.

speaker: JOANNE MORRIS
line: I've heard enough from you for one lifetime, Morris. Go tell it to that tramp of yours, that Scully, whatshername.

speaker: MULDER AS MORRIS
line: Dana Scully- Special Agent Dana Scully.

speaker: JOANNE MORRIS
line: Special Tramp Dana Scully.

speaker: MULDER AS MORRIS
line: She's my partner, Joanne.

speaker: JOANNE MORRIS
line: I'm supposed to be your partner.

speaker: MULDER AS MORRIS
line: My name is not Morris Fletcher. It's Fox Mulder. Special Agent Fox Mulder with the FBI. Dana Scully is my FBI partner. I am not your husband we are not married, we are complete strangers and I have a whole other life that I'm desperately trying to get back to.

speaker: JOANNE MORRIS
line: You know, Morris most men when they have a mid-life crisis they go out and buy themselves a sports car. They don't run around calling themselves Fox.

speaker: MULDER AS MORRIS
line: I want you to look out the window. Will you just look out the window with me for a second? See that car down there? See the two men in it? They're surveilling me. They're spying on me. I don't know if your husband ever told you this but he has a very dangerous job and those two men in that car, like you, think that I'm him only they don't trust me. So, one false move and I'm history. Which means that your husband will also be history because I won't be able to get back and set things the way they're supposed to be. Do you understand what I'm saying to you?

speaker: JOANNE MORRIS
line: Morris, if you don't like the man you've become I don't blame you one bit. But this flight from reality isn't the answer. Accept who you are. However repulsive that may be.

speaker: MORRIS AS MULDER
line: Perfect timing. Welcome.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Wow. Mulder.

speaker: MORRIS AS MULDER
line: You like, huh? Yeah, I thought it was time I stopped living like a frat boy. Come on and see the rest of the place. Over there.

speaker: SCULLY
line: I didn't even know you had a bedroom.

speaker: MORRIS AS MULDER
line: Oh, yeah. Yeah, got to have someplace to lounge around and read the Sunday New York times, you know.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Uh, no, that's okay. Thanks.

speaker: MORRIS AS MULDER
line: Seriously, just check it out. Seriously.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Oh!

speaker: MORRIS AS MULDER
line: Whoa! Uh-oh.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Mulder...

speaker: MULDER AS MORRIS AS MULDER
line: Maybe I like to read the New York Times backwards.

speaker: MORRIS AS MULDER
line: Do you hate it?

speaker: SCULLY
line: No, I don't hate it.

speaker: MORRIS AS MULDER
line: Well, all right then. Uh, don't go away.

speaker: MORRIS AS MULDER
line: Let's get it on Let's get it on Let's get it on Let's get it on Tonight is the night...

speaker: SCULLY
line: ,Do you know what would really be fun?

speaker: MORRIS AS MULDER
line: What?

speaker: MORRIS AS MULDER
line: Oh, yeah. Me first?

speaker: SCULLY
line: You first.

speaker: MORRIS AS MULDER
line: First time. Now what?

speaker: SCULLY
line: You're not Mulder.

speaker: MORRIS AS MULDER
line: What?

speaker: MORRIS AS MULDER
line: Baby...

speaker: SCULLY
line: "Baby" me and you'll be peeing through a catheter. Your name is Morris Fletcher. It was Mulder who was arrested in the desert. He was telling the truth about you. Now, how do we get things back to normal?

speaker: MORRIS AS MULDER
line: How should I know? I wouldn't do it even if I could. You saw my wife. Do you think I want to go back to that? Two kids who'd probably kill me in my sleep for the insurance money. A $400,000 mortgage on a house that just appraised at $226,000. And my job... Yee-gods. You think being a man in black is all voodoo mind control? I can see the paperwork.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Are you through?

speaker: MORRIS AS MULDER
line: As far as I'm concerned this thing is a gift from heaven. Besides, no one is ever going to believe you so you might as well just get used to me being here.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Or I just shoot you... Baby.

speaker: MORRIS AS MULDER
line: I'm telling you, I have no idea how to change things back.

speaker: SCULLY
line: What about Mulder's source? The man he was supposed to meet in the desert? What about him? Do you know how to get in touch with him?

speaker: MORRIS AS MULDER
line: I don't know anything about that. Sorry. You're out of luck.

speaker: ANSWERING MACHINE
line: Hello, hello. I'm very busy entertaining a *special* guest. Leave a message and I'll get back to you.

speaker: MAN ON ANSWERING MACHINE
line: Agent Mulder, I'm trying you one last time. Are you or are you not interested in the classified information I have to give you? Please pick up the phone if you're there.

speaker: MORRIS AS MULDER
line: Mulder.

speaker: MAN ON ANSWERING MACHINE
line: Agent Mulder, listen very carefully.

speaker: JOANNE MORRIS
line: Well, I guess we've given the neighbors enough to talk about. For God's sake, Morris at first you couldn't wait to get away from me and now you won't leave the house.

speaker: MULDER AS MORRIS
line: Where can we go?

speaker: JOANNE MORRIS
line: What do you mean?

speaker: MULDER AS MORRIS
line: You're right. We should get out of the house. Go someplace with a lot of people.

speaker: JOANNE MORRIS
line: Someplace with a lot of people?

speaker: MULDER AS MORRIS
line: Mm-hmm.

speaker: JOANNE MORRIS
line: In Rachel, Nevada?

speaker: MULDER AS MORRIS
line: What do you say?

speaker: MORRIS AS MULDER
line: All right, let's run through this one more time. I'll go in there alone, just like you told me to. He'll be wearing a blue Buffalo Bills cap.

speaker: SCULLY
line: And?

speaker: MORRIS AS MULDER
line: And if I try and slip out the back door da-da-da-dee-dee-dee.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Get going.

speaker: MORRIS AS MULDER
line: Can't we start over? You know, do that thing with the handcuffs?

speaker: MORRIS AS MULDER
line: Probably not your scene.

speaker: COUNTRY MUSIC ON JUKEBOX
line: I have waited for what seems Like a whole light-year Just to see your face Once again, my dear Shiny brown-eyed moonlight, Sunlight, starlight With big dark eyes That send me out of sight Now I'm staring At the stars...

speaker: JOANNE MORRIS
line: Are you expecting someone?

speaker: MULDER AS MORRIS
line: No, I'm not expecting someone.

speaker: JOANNE MORRIS
line: Because if you're here expecting someone and not to buy me a drink, you should tell me now so I can divorce you and take the house.

speaker: MULDER AS MORRIS
line: Joanne, have another white wine. Staring at the stars Wondering where you are...

speaker: MORRIS AS MULDER
line: You're the guy?!

speaker: GENERAL WEGMAN
line: Sit down.

speaker: MORRIS AS MULDER
line: Well, I'll be damned.

speaker: MULDER AS MORRIS
line: Whoa, ooh, that beer, it went right through me. I got to... I'll be right back.

speaker: MORRIS AS MULDER
line: You sabotaged a UFO?

speaker: GENERAL WEGMAN
line: Keep your voice down. I didn't intend for it to crash, Agent Mulder. I just meant to disable the stealth module so you could see it.

speaker: MULDER AS MORRIS
line: Scully.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Mulder? Is that really you?

speaker: MULDER AS MORRIS
line: What are you doing here?

speaker: SCULLY
line: I'm trying to figure out a way to help you.

speaker: MORRIS AS MULDER
line: What, are you, like, disgruntled?

speaker: GENERAL WEGMAN
line: You make me sound like some postal clerk. What you came for is on the floor by your feet. Starlight, star bright...

speaker: JOANNE MORRIS
line: Morris? In my memory you are moonlight, starlight With big dark eyes that Send me out of sight Now I'm staring at the stars Wondering where you are Wondering if I'll ever see Your face again Now I'm staring at the stars Wondering where you are...

speaker: JEFF
line: Joanne? Hey, how's it going? Listen, have you seen Morry?

speaker: JOANNE MORRIS
line: You bet I've seen him.

speaker: JEFF
line: Hey, hey, whoa, guys. Guys. What the hell was that, Morry?

speaker: MULDER AS MORRIS
line: I guess I make a lousy husband.

speaker: JEFF
line: I'll talk to her.

speaker: MULDER AS MORRIS
line: So you're the guy that wants my life. I assume that includes all the ass-kickings.

speaker: MORRIS AS MULDER
line: Oh, no... You don't want to do this.

speaker: MULDER AS MORRIS
line: Yeah, I do.

speaker: MORRIS AS MULDER
line: Jeff's outside.

speaker: MULDER AS MORRIS
line: So what?

speaker: MORRIS AS MULDER
line: If he sees us together, we're both dead. Especially when he sees this.

speaker: MULDER AS MORRIS
line: You take that to Scully right now.

speaker: MORRIS AS MULDER
line: You must have some sort of waxy buildup. I said Jeff's here. No way am I going out there until he leaves. You sneak it past him. You're his buddy.

speaker: MULDER AS MORRIS
line: His buddy? He doesn't trust me as far as he can throw me. You saw to that.

speaker: GENERAL WEGMAN
line: Oh, geez.

speaker: MULDER AS MORRIS
line: Hey.

speaker: GENERAL WEGMAN
line: Hey....as long as the sun would shine You would love me Love me And I hope You'll love the sunshine One more time...

speaker: (SHORT TIME LATER
line: GENERAL WEGMAN exits the bathroom observed by SCULLY and JEFF.)

speaker: GENERAL WEGMAN
line: Jeff.

speaker: JEFF
line: General Wegman.

speaker: GENERAL WEGMAN
line: You men, come with me.

speaker: JEFF
line: Sir... What are we, uh...?

speaker: GENERAL WEGMAN
line: There. Detain that man.

speaker: JEFF
line: Morris... Stop.

speaker: MULDER AS MORRIS
line: Hey, guys.

speaker: JEFF
line: What's in the bag, Morris?

speaker: MULDER AS MORRIS
line: It's, uh... Beer.

speaker: GENERAL WEGMAN
line: You sure it's not a flight data recorder?

speaker: MULDER AS MORRIS
line: No, it's beer.

speaker: MORRIS AS MULDER
line: Suckers.

speaker: LANGLY
line: Mmm. More huevos rancheros.

speaker: FROHIKE
line: Mas huevos rancheros.

speaker: BYERS
line: Por favor.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Open up.

speaker: FROHIKE
line: Mulder... If I'd known you were coming I would have made more salsa.

speaker: SCULLY
line: We need your help right now.

speaker: LANGLY
line: Who crashed?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Who, what, why. I need to know everything that's on that data recorder.

speaker: BYERS
line: It's similar in size and shape to the FDRs on the SR-71.

speaker: FROHIKE
line: Well, that's definitely not standard issue.

speaker: BYERS
line: Where did you get this?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Groom Lake. Outside Area 51.

speaker: FROHIKE
line: Dreamland.

speaker: LANGLY
line: The Aurora spy plane.

speaker: SCULLY
line: What's that?

speaker: FROHIKE
line: Black world. Top, top secret. A skunkworks special.

speaker: BYERS
line: Aurora is a hypersonic reconnaissance aircraft fueled with slush- hydrogen.

speaker: LANGLY
line: Or methylcyclohexane.

speaker: FROHIKE
line: What's with him?

speaker: MORRIS AS MULDER
line: You guys like the name? I'm going to go with either "Aurora" or "Borealis."

speaker: FROHIKE
line: What the hell's he talking about?

speaker: BYERS
line: Mulder...

speaker: SCULLY
line: He's not Mulder.

speaker: LANGLY
line: Huh?

speaker: SCULLY
line: We think the crash of this particular aircraft-- whatever it was-- resulted in a, uh...

speaker: MORRIS AS MULDER
line: My name is Morris Fletcher. I work inside Area 51. I assumed Mulder's identity through a warp in the space-time continuum.

speaker: MORRIS AS MULDER
line: Trust me, little man, I ain't him. Oh, I love you guys. I really do. I mean, you're the "Lone Gunmen," aren't you? You guys are my heroes. I mean, look at this crap you print.

speaker: BYERS
line: We uncover the truth.

speaker: MORRIS AS MULDER
line: Oh, the truth. Well, see that's what's so great about you monkeys. Not only do you believe this horse pucky that we create you broadcast it as well. I mean, look at this.

speaker: MORRIS AS MULDER
line: There is no Saddam Hussein. This guy's name is John Gillnitz. We found him doing dinner theater in Tulsa. Did a mean King and I. Plays good ethnics.

speaker: LANGLY
line: You're trying to say that Saddam Hussein's a government plant?

speaker: MORRIS AS MULDER
line: I'm saying I invented the guy. We set him up in '79. He rattles his saber whenever we need a good distraction. Ah... If you boys only knew how many of your stories I dreamed up while sitting on the pot.

speaker: FROHIKE
line: What stories?

speaker: MORRIS AS MULDER
line: Oh, I'm sorry, Melvin, that's classified.

speaker: FROHIKE
line: The name's Frohike, you punk ass. What the hell you do with Mulder?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Shut up, all of you. If you guys want Mulder back, get me these results.

speaker: GENERAL WEGMAN
line: Who is it?

speaker: MULDER AS MORRIS
line: Morris Fletcher.

speaker: GENERAL WEGMAN
line: Come in. We shouldn't be seen together. Not after last night. Fletcher... Mulder... Whoever you are.

speaker: MULDER AS MORRIS
line: I'm hoping this'll be our last meeting. Agent Scully's flying back with the analysis of that flight data recorder.

speaker: GENERAL WEGMAN
line: It'll be too late to save me.

speaker: MULDER AS MORRIS
line: I know. The real Morris Fletcher knows you're the leak.

speaker: GENERAL WEGMAN
line: Once you get back-- if you get back-- he'll have me arrested. Disappeared. Even if he doesn't his colleagues will figure out soon enough I sabotaged that craft.

speaker: MULDER AS MORRIS
line: Why'd you do it?

speaker: GENERAL WEGMAN
line: I didn't mean for it to crash. I just wanted you to see it.

speaker: MULDER AS MORRIS
line: Well, why?

speaker: GENERAL WEGMAN
line: There comes a time when you... look back instead of forward... See the sum of your life. My entire career has been spent hiding the truth from the American people destroying, in a way, that which was most precious to me.

speaker: MULDER AS MORRIS
line: What is the truth?

speaker: GENERAL WEGMAN
line: You mean... You don't know?

speaker: MULDER AS MORRIS
line: Don't know what?

speaker: GENERAL WEGMAN
line: The truth - what *is* going on here at Area 51? What are these black-budget projects? We just fly these birds. They don't tell us what makes them go. They engineer them all up in Utah.

speaker: MULDER AS MORRIS
line: Well, if you don't know, why'd you call me?

speaker: GENERAL WEGMAN
line: Well, I... I've seen your file. You've chased flying saucers for years. Do aliens really exist, Agent Mulder?

speaker: FROHIKE
line: Something's coming up.

speaker: BYERS
line: Got it.

speaker: SCULLY
line: What is it?

speaker: BYERS
line: We broke the encryption.

speaker: LANGLY
line: This baby records the telemetry of 28 systems including airspeed, fuselage torque and delta-v.

speaker: FROHIKE
line: Yeah, all the usual readouts, but, uh... What are these?

speaker: BYERS
line: Tachyon flux... Gravitational displacement.

speaker: FROHIKE
line: "Aurora," my ass. What have you guys been flying out there?

speaker: SCULLY
line: All right, I want you guys to analyze that data. Morris...

speaker: MORRIS AS MULDER
line: This is one of mine.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Get your butt in gear.

speaker: MORRIS AS MULDER
line: You're going to miss me when I'm gone.

speaker: FROHIKE
line: Fat chance, laughing boy.

speaker: MORRIS AS MULDER
line: Back off, sneezy.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Enough. Call me when you guys have some answers.

speaker: GUY 1
line: Ah, far out. The black mailbox.

speaker: GUY 2
line: Dude, that's a white mailbox.

speaker: GUY 1
line: No, they painted it white to hide it. This is the black mailbox. The best place to see Freedom Mountain and the UFOs over Dreamland, man. I know a guy who saw five in one night. He said they danced in the sky. You guys hear that? What the hell? Cool. Did you guys see that?

speaker: MULDER AS MORRIS
line: You don't look too happy. Don't tell me I'm going to have to put two kids through school.

speaker: SCULLY
line: That is you in there, Mulder, isn't it?

speaker: SCULLY
line: I, uh... I just got off the phone with Frohike. They were able to download and analyze the crash data and, yes, there was an anomalous event that night.

speaker: MULDER AS MORRIS
line: And how do I get back?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Well, that's just it. It's all about random moments in time... About a series of variables approaching an event horizon. And even if we... could recreate that moment if we could sabotage another craft... Mulder, if we were... If we were off... If the event were off by even one millisecond...

speaker: MULDER AS MORRIS
line: I might wind up with my head in a rock.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Something like that, yeah.

speaker: MULDER AS MORRIS
line: What about him? I mean, me. Whatever. Whoever he is.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Agent Mulder has become AD Kersh's new golden boy. He's been tasked with returning the flight data recorder that he and I stole. The son of a bitch confesses to Kersh even more than I do to my priest. I'm just tagging along for the ride.

speaker: MULDER AS MORRIS
line: What do you mean, "just tagging along"?

speaker: SCULLY
line: I'm out of the Bureau. I've been censured and relieved of my position.

speaker: MULDER AS MORRIS
line: No. You can explain it to them like you explained it to me. You have the data. You can make them understand. You can get your job back.

speaker: SCULLY
line: I'd kiss you if you weren't so damn ugly.

speaker: MORRIS AS MULDER
line: Take a picture-- it'll last longer.

speaker: MULDER AS MORRIS
line: If I... shoot him is that murder or suicide?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Neither, if I do it first.

speaker: MULDER AS MORRIS
line: Hey, Scully...

speaker: GUY 1
line: Stop! Stop! Stop! Stop! Stop! You got to help me! You got to help me! Open the window! Please, open your window!

speaker: GUY 1
line: I need to talk to you! Please, I need somebody to help me. It's this thing... It was like, like, like a wave... Like all squiggly and everything... And... And their faces, they, they stuck together! And, and, and her arm-- it was coming through his chest!

speaker: GUY 2
line: Sam, man, where you been? Who's the dude?

speaker: GUY 1
line: I swear, man... They were messed up.

speaker: HOWARD
line: I believe you.

speaker: MORRIS AS MULDER
line: So the motel guy wants cash. Won't take credit card-- do FBI." I tell him we're investigating crappy motels in the Southwest. He'd better watch his behind. So guess what? The guy gives me the room for free and he throws in a six-pack of brews to boot. I love this job! Listen, Dana, after we return this flight recorder what do you say I have a word with the big man-- see if I can get you your job back? We could have lots of fun together once you got to know me. You know I'd change.

speaker: SCULLY
line: I've still got my gun.

speaker: MORRIS AS MULDER
line: All right, already.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Wait a second, hold on. Back up.

speaker: MORRIS AS MULDER
line: What is it?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Back up.

speaker: PREVIOUSLY RUDE ATTENDANT
line: Can I help you, ma'am?

speaker: SCULLY
line: I don't understand. This-this place was burnt to the ground.

speaker: PREVIOUSLY RUDE ATTENDANT
line: I don't think so.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Yeah... This place, two nights ago.

speaker: PREVIOULSLY RUDE ATTENDANT
line: I think I'd remember that.

speaker: LANA CHEE/PILOT
line: What's going on?

speaker: MULDER AS MORRIS
line: What are you doing here?

speaker: SCULLY
line: I need to talk to you. Something's happened.

speaker: JOANNE MORRIS
line: Morris! Don't forget your stupid chair! You and it should be very happy together! Terence, get back inside. You got a lot of gall coming back here, sister

speaker: MULDER AS MORRIS
line: Joanne, I told you-- I'm not your husband. This man is.

speaker: JOANNE MORRIS
line: You come here to watch my family fall apart? You getting some kind of big kick out of that?

speaker: SCULLY
line: I have to talk to you alone.

speaker: JOANNE MORRIS
line: Homewrecker!

speaker: MORRIS AS MULDER
line: Careful. You're going to bust a lung.

speaker: JOANNE MORRIS
line: Leave me alone.

speaker: MORRIS AS MULDER
line: Joanne... What he said about me being your husband-- it's true.

speaker: JOANNE MORRIS
line: Get the hell off my porch.

speaker: MORRIS AS MULDER
line: We got married on June 13, 1978. It rained that day. You got mad at me at the reception because I said couldn't see the cake behind your fat ass. Remember our first apartment-- that dump in Pentagon City? You'd turn the air conditioner on and the lights would go out? Or when you were pregnant how I'd tickle your kneecaps to make you laugh? Remember? Remember the night Chrissy was born? When I held her in my arms all red-faced and screaming?

speaker: JOANNE MORRIS
line: That was the only time I ever saw you cry. Oh, my god... Morris? Is that you?

speaker: MULDER AS MORRIS
line: Come on, Morris. Let's go.

speaker: JOANNE MORRIS
line: What do you mean, go? Where are you taking him?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Mrs. Fletcher, we have reason to believe that whatever event caused this to happen may be in the process of reversing.

speaker: MULDER AS MORRIS
line: We got to get back to that highway, back to the exact spot where this all began. It may be our only chance.

speaker: JEFF
line: Sorry, Morris. A traitor's a traitor.

speaker: MULDER AS MORRIS
line: This isn't what it looks like.

speaker: SOLDIER
line: Got it!

speaker: SOLDIER
line: Sir.

speaker: JEFF
line: What are you doing?

speaker: HOWARD
line: I'm cleaning up a mess.

speaker: JEFF
line: What are you talking about?

speaker: HOWARD
line: About an hour ago I put Captain McDonough and Mrs. Chee back where they belong. Now it's their turn.

speaker: MULDER AS MORRIS
line: The warp that started this is snapping back like a rubber band.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Only we have to be in its path when it happens.

speaker: MULDER
line: Why are you doing this?

speaker: HOWARD
line: Till now, I had a spotless career record. I want that back.

speaker: MORRIS AS MULDER
line: So this is time snapping back?

speaker: MULDER AS MORRIS
line: It'll be like the last few days never happened. You won't remember any of this.

speaker: MORRIS AS MULDER
line: Oh. Well, in that case, Dana... It's been real.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Come on, Mulder. Let's go.

speaker: MULDER
line: Mulder.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Mulder, it's me. I just wanted to let you know that we slipped under Kersh's radar. Our little field trip to Nevada went unnoticed.

speaker: MULDER
line: Oh, yeah?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Mulder, I'm sorry that your confidential source didn't pan out.

speaker: MULDER
line: Well, I guess you were right, Scully. Just another crackpot who watches too much Star Trek.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Good night.

speaker: MULDER
line: Hey, Scully? I, uh, know it's not your normal life, but... Thanks for coming out there with me.

speaker: SCULLY
line: You're welcome.
